author: Staff Reporter
text:
Madras High Court advocates will be observing Friday as a ‘black day’ in view of the alleged inaction against police officials involved in the attack against lawyers on the High Court premises seven years ago.

On February 19, 2009 a clash between police and advocates took place. A police station located on the campus was set ablaze by lawyers and vehicles were damaged by the police. Over 50 advocates, including a then sitting judge of the High Court and several policemen were injured. Since then the advocates have been observing ‘black day’ demanding action against police officials responsible for the attack. The Madras High Court Advocates Association and the Women Lawyers Association have passed resolutions that February 19, 2016 will be observed as a ‘black day.’ It would be the first boycott after the CISF took over the High Court security.

Demand action against police officials for 2009 clash
title: Lawyers to observe ‘black day’ today
